definitions: roll of parchment or paper containing written text
ornamental design featuring spiral or curved elements in architecture
vertical or horizontal movement through digital content on a screen
examples: The ancient scroll contained secrets lost for centuries
Medieval monks carefully copied texts onto parchment scrolls
The baroque ceiling featured elaborate scrolls and flourishes
Stone scrolls decorated the capitals of the Greek columns
She had to scroll down to find the comment section
The infinite scroll kept loading more social media posts

definitions: person who is extremely stingy with money and lacks generosity or compassion
examples: Don't be such a scrooge about buying office coffee
The old scrooge refused to donate to any charity

definitions: external pouch of skin containing the testicles in male mammals
examples: The doctor examined the patient's scrotum for abnormalities
Temperature regulation of the scrotum is essential for sperm production

definitions: act of cleaning something by rubbing hard with brush
area covered with low shrubs and stunted trees
loose-fitting sanitary clothing worn by medical personnel
examples: Give the floor a good scrub before the inspection
The weekly scrub removed all the built-up grime
Desert scrub covered the harsh landscape for miles
Fire swept quickly through the dry scrub vegetation
The nurse changed into fresh scrubs before surgery
Green scrubs are standard in most operating rooms

definitions: brush or pad used for scrubbing surfaces clean
industrial device that removes pollutants from exhaust gases or liquids
examples: Use the pot scrubber to remove the burnt food
The floor scrubber made cleaning the warehouse much easier
The factory installed scrubbers to reduce sulfur dioxide emissions
Modern ships use scrubbers to clean exhaust gases

definitions: action of cleaning vigorously with a brush or abrasive
cancellation or postponement of a planned event or launch
examples: The scrubbing of the kitchen tiles took three hours
Constant scrubbing had worn away the paint
The scrubbing of the launch disappointed thousands of spectators
Weather conditions led to the scrubbing of today's mission

definitions: area of land covered with scrub vegetation and low bushes
examples: Cattle grazed on the sparse scrubland near the ranch
The arid scrubland supported surprisingly diverse wildlife

definitions: tight formation of players pushing against each other to restart play in rugby
iterative framework for managing product development in agile project management
examples: The referee called for a scrum after the forward pass
Both teams locked together in a powerful scrum
The development team held daily scrum meetings
They adopted scrum methodology to improve project delivery

definitions: critical observation or detailed examination of something to assess quality or detect problems
examples: The proposal came under intense scrutiny from regulators
Her research methodology withstood rigorous academic scrutiny

definitions: self-contained underwater breathing apparatus used for diving
examples: She earned her scuba certification last summer in Hawaii
The divers checked their scuba gear before entering the water

definitions: low patches of cloud moving rapidly driven by wind
type of tactical ballistic missile originally developed by Soviet Union
examples: Dark scud raced across the stormy sky
Layers of scud obscured the mountain peaks
The military tracked incoming scud missiles on radar
Scud attacks terrorized civilians during the conflict

definitions: short confused fight or struggle at close quarters
examples: A scuffle broke out between protesters and police
The playground scuffle ended when teachers intervened

definitions: oar used with twisting motion at stern of boat
light narrow racing boat propelled by one or more rowers
examples: He mastered the technique of using a single scull
The rower gripped both sculls firmly
The single scull glided silently across the lake
Olympic sculls are built for maximum speed

definitions: form of rowing where each rower uses two oars
examples: She practiced sculling every morning on the river
Sculling requires excellent coordination and balance

definitions: artist who creates three-dimensional artworks by carving or molding materials
examples: The sculptor spent months carving the marble statue
Famous sculptors often work with bronze and stone

definitions: three-dimensional work of art created by shaping or combining materials
art of making three-dimensional representative or abstract forms
examples: The bronze sculpture stood prominently in the town square
Ancient Greek sculptures influenced Western art for centuries
She studied sculpture at the prestigious art academy
Modern sculpture often challenges traditional artistic boundaries

definitions: layer of dirt or froth on top of liquid
contemptible or worthless person regarded with disgust
examples: Green scum covered the stagnant pond water
She skimmed the scum off the boiling soup
They called him scum for betraying his friends
Criminal scum terrorized the neighborhood

definitions: rapid movement with short quick steps especially when hurried or nervous
examples: Mice scurry through the walls at night
Workers scurry to finish before the deadline

definitions: disease caused by vitamin C deficiency characterized by bleeding gums and weakness
examples: Sailors suffered from scurvy on long ocean voyages
Citrus fruits prevented scurvy among British naval crews

definitions: metal container for holding coal beside fireplace
quick shuffling pace or run with short rapid steps
hatch or opening in ship's deck or hull
examples: The coal scuttle sat empty beside the cold fireplace
She filled the scuttle with fresh coal
The crab's sideways scuttle amused the beach visitors
He heard the scuttle of rats in the attic
Sailors secured the scuttle before the storm hit
Water poured through the open scuttle

definitions: agricultural tool with long curved blade attached to handle for cutting crops
examples: The farmer sharpened his scythe before harvesting wheat
Death is often depicted carrying a scythe

definitions: large body of salt water covering most of earth's surface
overwhelming quantity or expanse of something
examples: Ships disappeared into fog on the North Sea
The Mediterranean Sea connects Europe, Africa, and Asia
She faced a sea of troubles after losing her job
A sea of fans filled the stadium

definitions: ground under the sea or ocean floor
examples: Submarines rest on the seabed during covert operations
Scientists map the seabed to understand plate tectonics

definitions: bird that spends most of its life at sea or coastal areas
examples: Seabirds nested on the remote clifftops
Oil spills devastate local seabird populations

definitions: region bordering the sea or coastline of a country
examples: Cities along the eastern seaboard faced the hurricane
The Atlantic seaboard has dense population centers

definitions: land along the edge of the sea or ocean
examples: Erosion threatens homes built near the seacoast
The rugged seacoast attracted landscape painters

definitions: person who regularly travels or works at sea
examples: Ancient seafarers navigated by the stars
The old seafarer told tales of distant ports

definitions: practice of traveling by sea especially as occupation or way of life
examples: The nation's seafaring tradition spans five centuries
Seafaring required courage and navigational skills

definitions: edible fish and shellfish from the sea used as food
examples: The restaurant specializes in fresh local seafood
Seafood provides important omega-3 fatty acids

definitions: part of coastal town facing the sea with buildings and promenade
examples: Hotels line the seafront offering ocean views
The Victorian seafront attracts summer tourists

definitions: common gray and white bird found near seas and coasts
examples: Seagulls swooped down to steal the tourist's sandwich
The seagull's cry echoed across the harbor

definitions: small marine fish with horse-like head swimming upright using dorsal fin
examples: Male seahorses carry eggs in their pouch until birth
The tiny seahorse clung to seaweed with its tail

definitions: aquatic mammal with flippers living in cold seas
device or substance used to close or secure something tightly
official mark or emblem authenticating a document
examples: Seals basked on the rocky shore in the sunshine
The harbor seal dove deep to catch fish
Check the seal on the jar before opening
The rubber seal prevents water from leaking
The document bore the official seal of the court
Kings pressed their seal into hot wax

definitions: material used to seal something to prevent passage of fluids
examples: Apply sealant around the bathtub to prevent leaks
The silicone sealant dried completely overnight

definitions: substance applied to porous surfaces to prevent absorption
person who hunts seals commercially
examples: Apply wood sealer before painting the deck
The concrete sealer protects against water damage
Nineteenth-century sealers decimated Arctic seal populations
The sealer's ship returned loaded with pelts

definitions: process of closing or securing something to prevent leakage
commercial hunting of seals for fur and oil
examples: Proper sealing prevents air conditioning loss
The sealing of the envelope ensures privacy
Sealing was a major industry in the nineteenth century
International treaties now regulate commercial sealing

definitions: line where two pieces of fabric are sewn together
layer of coal or mineral ore between rock strata
examples: The seam split when she bent down too quickly
Reinforce the seam with double stitching
Miners discovered a rich coal seam underground
The gold seam ran through the mountain

definitions: enlisted sailor in navy below petty officer
person whose occupation involves working on ships
examples: The seaman reported to his commanding officer
Seaman Johnson received a commendation for bravery
The experienced seaman knew every port in Asia
Merchant seaman face months away from home

definitions: skill and knowledge required to operate and navigate ships safely
examples: Good seamanship prevented disaster during the storm
The captain's seamanship saved the crew

definitions: underwater mountain rising from ocean floor but not reaching surface
examples: The seamount creates an upwelling rich in nutrients
Submarines use seamounts for navigation reference

definitions: aircraft designed to take off and land on water
examples: The seaplane landed smoothly on the lake surface
Remote islands depend on seaplanes for supplies

definitions: town or city with harbor for seagoing ships
examples: The busy seaport handles millions of containers annually
Ancient seaports facilitated trade between civilizations

definitions: act of looking carefully to find something or someone
careful examination of a place or person to find something
examples: The search for survivors continued through the night
Her search for meaning led to spiritual awakening
Police conducted a search of the suspect's home
The border search revealed hidden contraband

definitions: person who searches for something or someone
examples: Searchers combed the forest for the missing hiker
Job searchers face a competitive market

definitions: powerful electric light with concentrated beam that can be directed
examples: The searchlight swept across the prison yard
Ships use searchlights to navigate through fog

definitions: view or expanse of sea and coast
picture or painting depicting a scene at sea
examples: The restaurant offered a stunning seascape from every table
The rugged seascape attracted photographers
Turner's seascapes capture the drama of storms at sea
She collected seascapes by local artists

definitions: hard protective outer case of marine mollusks found on beaches
examples: Children collected colorful seashells along the shore
The conch seashell produced a haunting sound

definitions: land along the edge of the sea especially the beach area
examples: Families picnicked on the sandy seashore
Tide pools along the seashore contained starfish

definitions: area or town next to the sea especially as vacation destination
examples: They rented a cottage at the seaside for summer
The seaside resort bustled with tourists

definitions: one of four divisions of the year marked by weather patterns
period when particular sport or activity occurs
process of adding flavor or allowing something to mature
examples: Spring season brings blooming flowers and warmer weather
The rainy season lasts from June to September
Basketball season runs from October through April
The theater season features six new productions
Season the steak with salt and pepper
The wood needs to season for a year
